text: Paul Amyrault (some sources Amyrauld) was a 17th-century Anglican priest in Ireland."A New History of Ireland" T. W. Moody, F. X. Martin, F.J. Byrne and Cosgrove, A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 Amyrault was of Hugenot descent."The Huguenot Settlements in Ireland" Lawless, G p208:Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Company; 2009 By Grace Lawless LeeHe was Archdeacon of Kilfenora from 1663Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (Third Edition, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. pp. 360–361 to 1690;"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p512 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 Provost of Tuam from 1667 to 1667;"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 4" Cotton,H. p24 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 and Chancellor of Killaloe from 1667 to 1674;"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p482 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 He was succeeded by his son Joseph Amyrault as Archdeacon of Kilfenora. ==References== Category:Archdeacons of Kilfenora Category:17th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Huguenots
title: Paul Amyrault
